intro: Tofieldia duidae, commonly known as the dwarf sedge, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its triangular stems and small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in montane or alpine environments. Tofieldia duidae plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various small organisms.
